title: Timeline
intro: The following puts my work experience in a narrative context. Of course, there's always the traditional résumé.

section.narrative: I am 77% through Design for the Web taught by Derek Wood. I love it.

skills.skill: Preparing and creating shareable rich metadata assets
Formatting responsive, dynamic, and accessible webapges via semantic HTML, JS, CSS, and PHP
Mapping out resilient design systems using custom properties, JSON, and PHP routing modules
Creating webpage layouts with Figma and Affinity 2 software.

section.narrative: Leaving Gaithersburg, Maryland for Burbank, California, I join John Muir Middle School as an ESL / English teacher.

skills.skill: Created over 185 unique standards-based lesson plans
Tracked student progress / behavior for ~100 English Language Learners
Developed academic and behavior intervention plans alongside counselors and school psychologists
Proctored high stakes state tests (CAASPP and ELPAC)

section.narrative: Back in the United States after a Fulbright Scholarship in Taiwan, I join White Oak Middle School as an ESL / English teacher. It will be an illuminating four years.

skills.skill: Designed language curriculum for ELD levels 1-4 and co-taught 6th-8th ELA classes
As required, co-taught STEM courses as ELD support teacher
Developed academic and behavior intervention plans alongside counselors and school psychologists
Proctored the national WIDA assessment to place incoming and current students

section.narrative: With my teaching master's degree fresh in hand, I board a plane to Taiwan to teach English as a Fulbright English Teaching Assistant. I travel to different elementary schools in Zhiben, a spa town in the Taitung region

skills.skill: Co-taught K-6 English classes alongside a certified local English teacher
Participated in local and national government events as a cultural representative of the United States
Recorded native prompts for the General English Proficiency Test
Gained familiarity with Mandarin's syntax, vocabulary, and socio-linguistic behavior

section.narrative:
I decided to attend Montclair State University's Teaching Program to realize my lifelong love for education. I achieved a Master's in Teaching English as a second language, only one course shy of a Master's in Linguistics due to a timing conflict with a Fulbright scholarship.

Over the summer, I intern at Educational Testing Services to research and write questions for the TOEFL internet-Based Test

skills.skill: Researched, created, and revised test items for the Speaking Section of the TOEFL iBT
Handled confidential test-taking data
Recorded native prompts for the General English Proficiency Test
Gained familiarity with Mandarin's syntax, vocabulary, and socio-linguistic behavior

section.narrative: To escape the recession and subsequent collapse of the publishing industry in NY, I fly to Seattle, Washington with no clear plan. I work at a call center for Nintendo of America before being promoted to assisting with data management.

skills.skill: Compiled user feedback from tech forums, social media, and the Miiverse (remember that?) into slide decks for upper management
Provided troubleshooting and IT support as needed
Assisted the social media manager with content creation and various administrative duties
Nintendo!

section.narrative: I graduated with a degree in Creative Writing from the University of Rochester and a certificate from NYU's Summer Publishing Institute. Should I move to New York City and become an assistant editor?

skills.skill: Proofread and reformatted 60 titles per month for online distribution via Amazon, Barnes & Noble, and iTunes bookstore
Compiled metadata for over 100 vendors, updated through FTP
Tracked sales and inventory from the digital marketplace using iTunes Producer and Amazon's Vendor Central
